storyInfo: Having followed a caravan on the trail of Dublinn forces, Bagpipe and Ch'en put a stop to a looting by the Taran refugees. After Reed explains that she's pursuing Dublinn all the same, Bagpipe and Ch'en express their willingness to help her.

attributes.content: You goddamned Tarans! Hell's bloody bells!
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: Cut 'em! Cut 'em down! Teach them a little lesson! Let them know never to lay hands on other people's stuff again!
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: Right you are! Let's teach the Tarans a lesson!
attributes.name: Caravan Guard

attributes.content: You hear that, you bloody rabble?
attributes.name: Caravan Guard

attributes.content: Ugh... my arm...
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: You want to put us, us Tarans... to death?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Hah... hah... get them! We'll bash these bloody business-doers in! We'll see who it is who dies!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Gurgh—
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Fall back!
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Wh-What are you using the sheath for? I paid you, in cash! Shape up and act proper!
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: The scabbard's enough. If you try anything else, I'll hold you off too.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Besides, Bagpipe and I are just traveling with you. We're not your hired guards. Don't get it twisted.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Tch, you're monsters, you and that loon with the spear...
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Looks like what we heard before was true. Your average caravans don't dare cross through here.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: So you're the leader... Your clothes are an eyesore.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Quick, Miss Ch'en, we're moving!
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: Hah, scared all of a sudden? Thought you were going to teach the Tarans a lesson?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Dublinn... spectre force, you goddamned maniacs! They were right, you run into those spectres anywhere where Tarans are!
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: That's right, you don't even need to piss us off. Just catch sight of us, and you'll be slaughtered to a man.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Really?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: After pursuing the spectre force with my friend for this long, I've gotten an idea of how they should seem.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Tch.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Ma'am, take your caravan out of here as fast as possible. Bagpipe and I will hold these bandits off.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: We'll pursue the Dublinn forces afterwards on our own. We won't be troubling you again.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Fine, fine... ugh, damn it all!
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: Still feel like chasing?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Rgh—! *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: ...Hey, Selmon, think of something! We need to catch the bastards and do them in!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Forget the bloody supplies... if they scarper, they'll report it to the police, and the army dossers.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: You think I'm too thick to figure that out?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: You're fully aware the force you're packing can't overcome my sword. That's why just now, you tried to bluff, to scare us off.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: ...Tch.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: So what do we do now? You've got SOME plan, right?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: ...No wonder you keep wearing this outfit, even with all the risk it brings you.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: You want to be this group's 'Leader'.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Ugh...!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: I only gave you a light knock. Your head'll be spinnin' for a bit, that's all. I've tested it plenty while savin' hostages—I wouldn't mess it up.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Oh, you're out. Did I use too much strength? Or have you lot not eaten for days? Really...?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I'm sorry... but, well, it's not right to loot either.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: —You're not springin' me!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: The instant the pike comes out behind her, Bagpipe instinctively blocks.
Both sides fall a step back. After seeing who it is, Bagpipe's eyes widen.
—Reed?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Are your wounds okay? Are you alright? What are you doin' out here in...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Uh—wait, wait, you're part of this robbery too? I can't just let you go, then.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...No. I wasn't in time to stop them.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But, regardless, I don't want them to be hurt... and I don't want them to be captured, either.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Och, then we're here on about the same mission. No need to eye me that carefully, now.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Whether a Victorian serviceman or a Rhodes Island operator, we can't be harmin' civilians. Me and Chenchen were here to mediate and all.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Um, I say that, but I'm sorry, I think my strength is a little much for the average folk...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: How's about I help you carry the unconscious someplace shady to rest? Were they headed for this village?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Please, I beg you, leave.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The conflict is defused.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Say it all you like, I'm still goin' to help. You've got somethin' on your mind from the looks of it, na?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Ah, alright, still not keen on speakin' then.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: They never let me visit you at Rhodes Island, and didn't tell me why either. Best I could guess was, you didn't want to be reminded of County Hillock.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...So what are you doin' out in these parts?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: And also, you look like you've been lost in the barrens for days now. What's your mission, even? Want me and Chenchen to come with you?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Oh, there's just so much I want to ask you, my brain's goin' haywire.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...No, it's alright. I just happened to be—invited by these people to... escort them.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: In the past, I'd operate alone in the country for very long stretches. The dangers of the wild—don't mean much to me.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: And also, I'm not here on a mission for Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: ...I'm pursuing some things related to Dublinn.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: No wonder... Me and Chenchen are doin' the same. Must be why we ran into each other.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You were so wounded, back in County Hillock. Dublinn must weigh like nothin' else on you too...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: There was a person in Dublinn—who changed my fate, so I want to... see, if I can still recover something from there.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Whether it relieves the pain they bring, or brings peace to myself.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: ...That's amazin'.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: We were comin' this way with the caravan lookin' for a Dublinn unit, who'd shown up here in recent. Don't know why, but when I saw you, that gave me the shock of my life.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Thank goodness you lot and Dublinn aren't tied up.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Say, I'll go have a talk with Chenchen, and we'll postpone the mission a few days. I bet she's just as willin' to help these people out.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: How many people did I just now have shadowing me as I entered this parlor? Take a guess?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: I have no interest in the act you put on in the midst of the Victorians and Tarans.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Then I really should thank you for the pains you took, rushing here to County Trent and drawing all the attention. I thought you'd spend a lot longer harboring yourself in the army.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: With The Leader's plans progressed to this stage, there is no real difference between my identity as part of Duke of Wellington's guard, and that as an officer of Dublinn.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Seeing as you have Caster's people surveilling you, they must have long gained possession of that information.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: We have little nibbles of Dublinn forces cropping up outside the cities, and the rumors of a major Dublinn force passing through... All put on show for them.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Sprinkle in a few mysterious trade orders, and now even the gossiping merchants know the Iron Duke has some design or other for this city.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Everyone is quietly making the rounds, frantically guessing what the Duke is borrowing Trent as a stage for.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Very much as The Leader expected.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Yes, if they'd realized our true aim too soon, and every Duke learned of The Leader's resolution in advance, I fear Oak Grove's outskirts would be in the same merry state Londinium is.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Say, are they more scared of the Sarkaz, or of the Tarans?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Trying to pit Tarans against Sarkaz? You have no right to make such jokes, Feline of Victoria.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: ...I hear 'The Spy' is dead.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Mmm, yes, and we've had access to far less intel from inside Londinium ever since. It really is a shame.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: It's not just Sarkaz in there. You have some... fairly interesting powers in hibernation.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Your impulsiveness will ruin your plans. I've said as much before.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Impulsiveness? My, scant few people would ever think THAT of me.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You should perish thoughts of offering Mandragora survival.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: She was used by 'The Elocutionist', to try and fracture Dublinn. She was meant to die in County Hillock along with those six traitors.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Mandragora was the one 'The Spy' most trusted. Executing her before confirming if 'The Spy' had turned his coat, well, that wouldn't have been the wise move.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Excuses.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Even if it wasn't worth myself or you in person, the task of supporting 'The Spy' should have gone to someone more dependable.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Oh? Come to speak of us, you never sat well with me. Don't you find it such good news that I've never had the chance to kill you?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Meaningless, glib blather.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: You can't be acting rashly before the Duke and The Leader make their final decision.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: If you can discern the importance of Londinium intel, then of course I can. But whether we ultimately march on Londinium or not, that's still an unknown variable.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Hinging upon our progress collaborating with the Duke?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Of course. Why else would I be so busy on my feet right now?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: ...Hmph. I still remember the enclave campaign four years ago. How bitterly we awaited the result of our partnership with the nobles.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: And meanwhile, all our errant representatives were circling thousands of kilometers out, patiently pulling through several weeks just to tell the Duke one single thing.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Harmonie, you'd best stand on The Leader's side.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Or else?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Mandragora is dead. I can stop investigating your whim to assist her.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: But she—she's still alive.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Oh, you mean that dear, pitiful Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: We cannot have a repeat of 'The Elocutionist's' conspiracy in County Hillock. Each day she lives is a threat to Dublinn and The Leader.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: The Leader has assigned control of her whereabouts to you. Don't let personal considerations affect you any further, Harmonie. You have little leeway left to fail.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Oh, you do fantasize far too much about the emotional life of a professional spy.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Fine, fine, you can stop boring into me with your eyes, 'Brigadier', unless you want to help by applying my makeup. I do have a dinner party to attend.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Not bad, Fionn. Just like back then. I always think you're a bit useless, but then every time, you get something done.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: *sigh* What use is borrowing this bit of rations going to do?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Those two are Victorians, right? They say, they'll go to the city to replace anything we don't need, and sort you lot out some batons for self-defense.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Shouldn't you be happy about getting a decent weapon?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Fine, you listen to your little radio, check if they're broadcasting about merchants being looted. Maybe those cowards are scared Dublinn will get back at them. Might not even report it at all...
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: ...Hey, Fionn?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: What are you peering at back there?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: ...That Infected handful. They've been following us at a far distance since we left the village.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Still? Surprised they've kept up with us going so fast, and them with their sick legs and children to carry.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Right, it must be murder on them coming with us.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I... I'm worried for Moran.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Her eyes went bad in that famine a few years back. She can't see the way in the dark. Now with the lights-out happening, there's not even a single lamp left on.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Oh, no, that's sorry to hear. So, can I ask what they're doing following us? Do we look like some kind of rescue team?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I don't know. Er, probably it's the clothes you're wearing?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Look, aside from me, everyone regards you like you're a real member of Dublinn.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: And everyone knows Dublinn's good to the Tarans. It's simple as that.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...I'll—go and see them.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh, you made me jump... Your voice sounds a little quivery, say. You alright?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...It wouldn't be bad—to have more people standing on guard duty... It'll be easier to avoid the patrol.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I'll... bring them with me.
attributes.name: Reed
